comment.text: Please push this to stable so libvirt isn't affected by the pkg-config breakage

long_desc.thetext:
Latest upstream release: 2.2.5
Current version/release in rawhide: 2.2.4-2.fc26
URL: http://www.wireshark.org/

Please consult the package updates policy before you issue an update to a stable branch: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Updates_Policy

More information about the service that created this bug can be found at: https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Upstream_release_monitoring

Please keep in mind that with any upstream change, there may also be packaging changes that need to be made. Specifically, please remember that it is your responsibility to review the new version to ensure that the licensing is still correct and that no non-free or legally problematic items have been added upstream.

Based on the information from anitya:  https://release-monitoring.org/project/5137/

Created attachment 1259809
[patch] Update to 2.2.5 (#1429067)

comment.text: Please push this to stable so libvirt isn't affected by the pkg-config breakage

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
Wireshark installs files in root directory.
wireshark-qt desktop file contains TryExec on non-existing file.

Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable):
wireshark-cli-2.2.4-2.fc26

Actual results:
# rpm -qf /wireshark_be.py 
wireshark-cli-2.2.4-2.fc26.i686
# rpm -qf /wireshark_gen.py 
wireshark-cli-2.2.4-2.fc26.i686

# grep TryExec /usr/share/applications/wireshark.desktop
TryExec=/usr/sbin/wireshark
# file /usr/sbin/wireshark
/usr/sbin/wireshark: cannot open `/usr/sbin/wireshark' (No such file or directory)
Thanks for your bug report. I'll fix this asap.

blocked.short_desc: CVE-2017-9352 wireshark: Bazaar dissector infinite loop (wnpa-sec-2017-22)

long_desc.thetext:
It was reported that Wireshark's Bazaar dissector could loop infinitely. It may be possible to make Wireshark crash by injecting a malformed packet onto the wire or by convincing someone to read a malformed packet trace file.

Upstream bug(s):

https://bugs.wireshark.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=13599

External References:

https://www.wireshark.org/security/wnpa-sec-2017-22.html

Created wireshark tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1458149]

Created wireshark tracking bugs for this issue:

Affects: fedora-all [bug 1458149]

This is an automatically created tracking bug!  It was created to ensure
that one or more security vulnerabilities are fixed in affected versions
of Fedora.

For comments that are specific to the vulnerability please use bugs filed
against the "Security Response" product referenced in the "Blocks" field.

For more information see:
http://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Security/TrackingBugs

When submitting as an update, use the fedpkg template provided in the next
comment(s).  This will include the bug IDs of this tracking bug as well as
the relevant top-level CVE bugs.

Please also mention the CVE IDs being fixed in the RPM changelog and the
fedpkg commit message.

NOTE: this issue affects multiple supported versions of Fedora. While only
one tracking bug has been filed, please correct all affected versions at
the same time.  If you need to fix the versions independent of each other,
you may clone this bug as appropriate.

[bug automatically created by: add-tracking-bugs]

Use the following template to for the 'fedpkg update' request to submit an
update for this issue as it contains the top-level parent bug(s) as well as
this tracking bug.  This will ensure that all associated bugs get updated
when new packages are pushed to stable.

=====

# bugfix, security, enhancement, newpackage (required)
type=security

# testing, stable
request=testing

# Bug numbers: 1234,9876
bugs=1458136,1458137,1458138,1458139,1458140,1458141,1458142,1458143,1458144,1458145,1458147,1458148,1458149

# Description of your update
notes=Security fix for CVE-2017-9352, CVE-2017-9348, CVE-2017-9351, CVE-2017-9346, CVE-2017-9345, CVE-2017-9349, CVE-2017-9350, CVE-2017-9344, CVE-2017-9343, CVE-2017-9347, CVE-2017-9354, CVE-2017-9353

# Enable request automation based on the stable/unstable karma thresholds
autokarma=True
stable_karma=3
unstable_karma=-3

# Automatically close bugs when this marked as stable
close_bugs=True

# Suggest that users restart after update
suggest_reboot=False

======

Additionally, you may opt to use the bodhi web interface to submit updates:

https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/new

comments.text: This update has been submitted for testing by msehnout.
This update has obsoleted [wireshark-2.2.6-4.fc26](https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2017-b2da0da0b7), and has inherited its bugs and notes.
This update has been pushed to testing.
Been using wireshark today, haven't hit any issues yet.
This update has reached 3 days in testing and can be pushed to stable now if the maintainer wishes
This update has been submitted for stable by msehnout.
This update has been pushed to stable.

notes:
Rebase to the newest upstream version. This release contains mostly bugfixes and no new features.

----

This update enables Lua support and also moves binaries into /usr/bin directory. The bug with scriptlets is resolved by removing the whole alternatives group prior to installing new packages.

----

New upstream release 2.2.6 with many CVE fixes

----

New upstream version and fixed issues with python macros
title: wireshark-2.2.7-1.fc26
